intro: Contortuplicata campylotricha, commonly known as the spiral-leaf curl plant, is a unique species characterized by its intricate, twisting foliage. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is native to tropical regions of South America. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are usually a mix of red and purple, attracting various pollinators.
